title: PM Modi Says Seeking US Trade Agreement "Very Soon"
description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi said Thursday that Washington and New Delhi are pushing to conclude a "mutually beneficial trade agreement," in remarks at a joint press conference with US President Donald Trump.
excerpt: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi said Thursday that Washington and New Delhi are pushing to conclude a "mutually beneficial trade agreement," in remarks at a joint press conference with US President Donald Trump.
text: PM Modi said that India will focus on trade in oil and gas in order to ensure country's energy security. Washington: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi said Thursday that Washington and New Delhi are pushing to conclude a "mutually beneficial trade agreement," in remarks at a joint press conference with US President Donald Trump."In order to ensure India's energy security, we will focus on trade in oil and gas. Investment in energy infrastructure will also increase in the area of nuclear energy," Mr Modi said, noting the pact should be finalized "very soon."(Except for the headline, this story has not been edited by NDTV staff and is published from a syndicated feed.)
html:
PM Modi said that India will focus on trade in oil and gas in order to ensure country's energy security.

Washington:

Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi said Thursday that Washington and New Delhi are pushing to conclude a "mutually beneficial trade agreement," in remarks at a joint press conference with US President Donald Trump.

"In order to ensure India's energy security, we will focus on trade in oil and gas. Investment in energy infrastructure will also increase in the area of nuclear energy," Mr Modi said, noting the pact should be finalized "very soon."

(Except for the headline, this story has not been edited by NDTV staff and is published from a syndicated feed.)
